DOC.brief_summary: Intestinal bacteria metabolize unabsorbed polyphenols ( plant compound ) produce small molecule may impact health . In addition , evidence suggest process may affect body fatness . This study aim investigate absorption blackberry polyphenols , impact intestinal bacteria , polyphenol metabolite form intestinal bacteria , process differ obese lean individual . It hypothesize polyphenol absorption metabolism differ obese lean individual difference intestinal microbiota may play role .
DOC.brief_title: Blackberry Flavonoid Absorption Effects Intestinal Bacteria
DOC.criteria: 2575 year old Use bloodthinning medication Coumadin ( warfarin ) , Dicumarol ( dicumarol ) , Miradon ( anisindione ) Presence gastrointestinal disease , metabolic disease , malabsorption syndrome may interfere study goal Have pregnant previous 12 month , currently pregnant lactating , plan become pregnant study Type 2 diabetes require use oral antidiabetic agent insulin Fasting triglyceride great 300 mg/dL Fasting glucose great 126 mg/dL History eat disorder dietary pattern consistent dietary intervention ( e.g. , vegetarian , low fat diet , high protein diet ) Use prescription overthecounter antiobesity medication supplement ( e.g. , phenylpropanolamine , ephedrine , caffeine ) least 6 month prior start study history surgical intervention obesity Active cardiovascular disease ( heart attack procedure within past three month participation cardiac rehabilitation program within last three month , stroke , history/treatment transient ischemic attack past three month , document history pulmonary embolus past six month ) . Use tobacco product past 3 month Unwillingness abstain herbal supplement two week prior study study Known ( selfreported ) allergy adverse reaction blackberry study food Unable unwilling give inform consent communicate study staff Selfreport alcohol substance abuse within past twelve month and/or current acute treatment rehabilitation program problem ( Longterm participation Alcoholics Anonymous exclusion ) Other medical , psychiatric , behavioral factor judgment Principal Investigator may interfere study participation ability follow intervention protocol
